script: K: I hope you don't mind me taking the liberty.
I was careful not to drag in any dirt.
SAPPER: I don't mind the dirt.
Are you Sapper Morton? Civic number NK68514?
I prefer to keep an empty stomach until the hard part of the day is done.
K: But you haven't always been a farmer, have you?
Let them take a look inside?
...if taking you in is an option...
...I would much prefer that to the alternative.
I'm sure you knew it would be someone in time.
I'm sorry it had to be me.
...if you could just look up and to the left, please.
SAPPER: How's it feel killing your own kind?
I don't retire my own kind because we don't run.
And you new models are happy scraping the shit...
You're hurt. I'm not paying for that.
He looks like he could take your head off.
...with a few more in his outfit I wouldn't mind closing out.
Come on home for your baseline.
K: Thirty meters to maximum depth.
Come on home before the storm.
K: And blood-black nothingness began to spin.
A system of cells interlinked within cells...
...interlinked within cells interlinked within one stem.
K: And dreadfully distinct against the dark, a tall white fountain played.
-You ever been in an institution? Cells. -Cells.
-Do they keep you in a cell? Cells. -Cells.
When you're not performing your duties, do they keep you in a little box? Cells.
What's it like to hold the hand of someone you love? Interlinked.
Did they teach you how to feel finger to finger? Interlinked.
Do you long for having your heart interlinked? Interlinked.
What's it like to hold your child in your arms? Interlinked.
Do you feel that there's a part of you that's missing? Interlinked.
Why don't you say that three times?
Within cells interlinked. Within cells interlinked.
You can pick up your bonus.
MAN: Connect to Off-world any time, any place.
WOMAN: K? I didn't hear you. You're early.
K: You want me to come back?
I had an accident at work. I think I ruined my shirt.
WOMAN: I'm sure I can fix that for you. Let me take a look at it.
-Do you want a drink first? -Mm-hm. Pour me one, will you?
I'm trying a new recipe. I just need a bit more practice.
I should have marinated it longer. I hope it isn't dry.
Did you know this song was released in 1966 on Reprise Records?
It was number one on the charts.
It won't be much longer. Just putting on the finishing touches.
Okay, it's ready. I hope you're gonna like it.
I told you not to fuss.
-You hate that book. -I don't wanna read either.
Do you wanna dance, or do you wanna open your present?
No, but let's just say that it is.
Honey, you can go anywhere you want in the world now.
Where do you wanna go first?
I'm so happy when I'm with you.
You don't have to say that.
JOSHI: The dig's come through. We have a new lead.
MAN: Your box is a military footlocker, issued to Sapper Morton...
...creatively repurposed as an ossuary: a box of bones.
Nothing else in it but hair.
The soil samples indicate that she's been buried for 30 years.
Bones all dismantled, fully cleaned, meticulously laid to rest.
No breaks, no sign of trauma, except...
It's a narrow birth canal. Baby must have got stuck.
JOSHI: She was pregnant? COCO: Mm.
That looks like an emergency C-section.
The cuts are clean. No sign of a struggle.
He was a combat medic. Maybe he tried to save her, and he just couldn't.
He didn't seem like the saving type.
He went to the trouble of burying her.
NANDEZ: Just dirt and worms. No other bodies.
The world is built on a wall.
Tell either side there's no wall, you bought a war.
It is my job to keep order.
That's what we do here. We keep order.
You have anything more to say?
I've never retired something that was born before.
To be born is to have a soul, I guess.
I wasn't aware that was an option, madam.
Hey. You've been getting on fine without one.
SAPPER: And you new models are happy scraping the shit...
Just checking in on an old serial number.
LUV: You can customize them as much as you'd like.
As human as you want them to be.
But your operation is strictly a drill site, isn't it?
I wouldn't waste your money on intelligence, attachment or appeal.
Unless you'd like to add some pleasure models to your order.
Would it be possible to reschedule this call, please?
FILE CLERK: Everyone remembers where they were at the Blackout. You?
K: That was a little before my time.
Mm. I was home with my folks, then 10 days of darkness.
When the lights came back, we were wiped clean.
Photos, files, every bit of data, pfft, gone. Bank records too. Heh.
It's funny it's only paper that lasted.
I mean, we had everything on drives. Everything, everything, everything. Heh.
My mom still cries over the lost baby pictures.
Well, it's a shame. You must have been adorable.
Pretty fractured. Not much on it.
One of the last gens, pre-Prohibition.
There must be something else we can find for him.
I'm here for Mr. Wallace. I'm Luv.
LUV: The ancient models give the entire endeavor a bad name.
What a gift, don't you think, from Mr. Wallace to the world?
The outer colonies would never have flourished had he not bought Tyrell...
To say the least of what we do.
I see you're also a customer.
Are you satisfied with our product?
Here. All the junk is in here.
Lucky for you, Mr. Wallace is a data hoarder.
No one's been down here in ages.
All our memory bearings from the time. They were all damaged in the Blackout.
He shows you his butterfly collection, plus the killing jar.
RACHAEL: I'd take him to the doctor.
DECKARD: There's a wasp crawling on your arm.
You come across a full-page nude photo of a girl.
RACHAEL: Is this testing whether I'm a Replicant or a lesbian, Mr. Deckard?
DECKARD: Just answer the questions, please.
It was unclear what she was, at least to someone.
We were difficult to spot then.
Was there anything unusual about how you found her?
You know how people are about old serial numbers.
Everyone just sleeps better when they know where they got to.
It is invigorating being asked personal questions.
Do you enjoy your work, officer?
Please thank Mr. Wallace for your time.
K: You worked with Officer Deckard...
What can you tell me about him?
So we worked together to keep it that way.
Anything else you can tell me?
He sure wasn't long for this world.
Any idea how I could contact him?
You wanted to review the new model, sir, before shipment?
MAN: An angel should never enter the kingdom of heaven...
Can you at least pronounce, A child is born?
Well, let us see her, then.
Before we even know what we are...
Now, let's have a look at you.
Yes, there were bad angels once.
That is how I took us to nine new worlds.
A child can count to nine on fingers.
Every leap of civilization was built off the back of a disposable workforce.
We lost our stomach for slaves...
But I can only make so many.
The dead space between the stars.
We need more Replicants than can ever be assembled.
Millions, so we can be trillions more.
We could storm Eden and retake her.
The man with the green jacket.
The one who killed Sapper. Find out what he knows.
Wanna buy a lady a cigarette?
Don't you know what I am?
Oh. Never seen a tree before.
Now, who keeps a dead tree?
You're not gonna kill me, are you?
Why don't you look under my eye and find out?
Of course not. Proper channels and paperwork. It's all here.
It's out. Already out. How long did that take?
So, what do you have for me? And don't say nothing.
Then what's this? What's that date? Is that a birthday? A death day?
Am I the only one that can see the fucking sunrise here?
You know, I've known a lot of your kind.
All useful, but with you, I sometimes forget.
We didn't have any of you where I was a kid.
Before you were under me, you have any memories from before?
...but they're not real. They're just implants.
From when you were a kid.
I feel strange sharing a childhood story, considering I was never a child.
Well, would it help you share if I told you it was an order?
I have one about a toy that I had.
All I remember is a group of boys trying to take it away from me.
I go looking for a place to hide it, and the only place is this dark furnace.
It's very dark, and I'm very scared...
...but this horse is all I have, so I go in anyway.
Later on, those kids find me...
...and they beat me to tell them where it is, but I don't.
Little K, fighting for what's his.
We're all just looking out for something real.
What happens if I finish that?
Shouldn't I get back to work, madam?
A and C and T and G.
The alphabet of you. All from four symbols.
I'm only two: One and zero.
Half as much but twice as elegant, sweetheart.
You didn't like her enough to tell her the truth.
...I'd be hunted for the rest of my life by someone just like me.
It's okay to dream a little.
K: Two people can't have identical DNA.
One of these isn't real. It's a copy.
They were both processed at the Morrill Cole Orphanage.
It says the girl died there.
You wanna go for a ride?
Two hundred feet to the east.
COTTON: Every last piece, or I'll put you outside where the sky is raining...
And if you're not working, I don't need you.
I don't need any of-- Hi.
The nickel is for the colonial ships.
Closest any of them or any of us is gonna get...
And I encourage play, I do. Keeps them occupied...
...and it makes them nimble, right? Ha-ha-ha.
It's work that molds them into a child worth having.
What sort do you have in mind?
No, no, no. This is just my game, and I play it fair.
No. No, I mean, bigger than you....
Bigger than you have tried to shut me down. Bigger than you.
And they were men, at that.
A little boy came through here about 30 years back.
I need to see your records.
Don't keep records that far back.
I think someone like you keeps a long memory.
Now you can tell me what you remember...
...or I can put a hole right here and take a look.
They were laughing and what was it you said? What'd you say?
A real boy needs a real name.
How do I know if a memory is an implant or not?
Nice to meet you, Officer KD6 - 3.7.
Sorry. It's a compromised immune system.
A life of freedom, so long as it's behind glass.
My parents had our passes in pocket, but I took sick.
So it was a new life for me.
And they put me in my cage...
...filled it with everything they could to keep me happy.
Except company, of course. And I was used to crowds.
What can I help you with?
Thought you might be able to help me with a case.
Oh, that's the most interesting thing I've been offered to help with in ages.
Do you mind if I work while you talk?
ANA: I promise I hear every word.
They say you're the best memory-maker there is.
ANA: Subcontract. I'm one of his suppliers.
He offered to buy me out, but I take my freedom where I can find it.
What makes your memories so authentic?
ANA: Well, there's a bit of every artist in their work.
But I was locked in a sterile chamber at 8...
...so if I wanted to see the world, I had to imagine it.
Wallace needs my talent to maintain a stable product.
Replicants live such hard lives, made to do what we'd rather not.
...but I can give you good memories to think back on and smile.
ANA: It's better than nice. It feels authentic.
And if you have authentic memories, you have real human responses.
Are they all constructed, or do you ever use ones that are real?
ANA: It's illegal to use real memories, officer.
How can you tell the difference?
They all think it's about more detail.
But that's not how memory works.
Anything real should be a mess.
Now, think about the memory you want me to see.
Not even that hard. Just picture it.
Drop your gun and keep your hands where I can see them.
Have you ever been in an institution? Cells.
When you're not performing your duties, do they keep you in a little box? Cells.
What's it like to hold the hand of someone you love?
INTERVIEWER: Within cells interlinked. K: Within the cells interlinked.
INTERVIEWER: What's it like to be filled with dread? Dreadfully.
Do you like being separated from other people? Distinct.
INTERVIEWER: Within cells interlinked. K: Within the cells interlinked.
INTERVIEWER: Within one stem. -Within one stem.
INTERVIEWER: And dreadfully distinct. K: And dreadfully distinct.
INTERVIEWER: Against the dark. K: Against the dark.
INTERVIEWER: A tall white fountain played.
K: A tall white fountain played.
INTERVIEWER: You're not even close to baseline.
What the fuck is with you?
I put you on a case.
I impressed on you the importance of that case...
...and then we pick you up fucking around outside an upgrade center?
Scan said you didn't look like you on the inside. Miles off your baseline.
-Do you know what that means? -I found the kid.
He was set up like a standard Replicant, put on a service job.
Even he didn't know who he was.
-What does that mean, it's done? -What you asked.
You just stopped a bomb from going off.
I can help you get out of this station alive...
...but you have 48 hours to get back on track.
And your next baseline test is out of my hands.
Thought you weren't interested, worky man.
JOI: You liked her. I could tell.
I wanna be real for you.
You have a special lady here.
Quiet now, I have to sync.
Joi goes anywhere you want her to go.
Not so much there as you think.
They'll be coming after me soon.
If they come here looking for you, they'll have access to all my memories.
You have to delete me from the console.
Think about it: If anything happens to this, that's it.
But I can't do it myself.
I don't need a real horse.
I don't need a real horse. I just wanna find out where it's from.
BADGER: It matches a dirty bomb.
K: There's only one place that dirty. -Mm.
Guess we're about to find out.
I have no idea. He's off-duty.
Well, except for the box of bones that you already took.
Which, I'll wager, wasn't enough. Here you are.
In the face of the fabulous new, your only thought is to kill it?
You can't hold the tide with a broom.
I'm gonna tell Mr. Wallace you tried to shoot me first.
So I had to kill you.
Then do what you gotta do.
MAN: Mightn't happen to have a piece of cheese about you, now?
Not much else to do around here at night anymore.
Many is the night I dream of cheese...
-I'm not here to take you in. -Oh, yeah?
Look, I don't wanna hurt you.
But you're not making it easy.
We could keep at this, or we could get a drink.
K: This is really something. -The whole town was something.
Win some money, lose some money.
They made money seem like candy.
Officer KD6 - 3.7-- That's not a name. That's a serial number.
-I wanna ask you some questions. -Like what?
Like what was her name, the mother of your child?
-You two live here together? -Too many questions.
I had your job. I was good at it.
-It was simpler then. -Why you making it complicated?
-Why don't you answer the question? -What question?
I didn't figure you as one for bullshit.
Who put it in the orphanage? Was it you?
I was long gone by then.
You didn't even meet your own kid?
I showed them how to scramble the records, cover their tracks.
Everyone had a part. Mine was to leave.
Then the Blackout came, paved over everything.
Couldn't have found the child if I tried.
I didn't want our child found...
I do hope you're satisfied with our product.
I love-- MARIETTE: Hey, there's someone who wants to meet you.
You must want me to look up and to the left.
She fought with Sapper on Calantha.
Did you help him hide the child?
A perfect little face crying up at me.
FREYSA: I held her as she died.
We hid the child and made a vow to keep our secret.
That's why Sapper let you kill him.
I knew that baby meant we are more than just slaves.
If a baby can come from one of us...
I want to free our people.
If you want to be free...
...our lives mean nothing next to a storm that's coming.
Dying for the right cause is the most human thing we can do.
You cannot allow Deckard to lead Wallace to me.
Deckard only wanted his baby to be safe.
When the time comes, I will show her to the world...
With my own eyes, I saw her come.
I dressed her in blue when it was time for her to go.
It was a boy that you hid.
That is just a piece of the puzzle.
We all wish it was us.
DECKARD: I showed them how to scramble the records...
FREYSA: With my own eyes, I saw her come.
I dressed her in blue when it was time for her to go.
ANA: There's a bit of every artist in their work.
Never a thought of what to do if it made land.
All the courage in the world cannot alter fact.
I have wanted to meet you for so very long.
You are a wonder to me, Mr. Deckard.
Yet the pins do not align. The door remains locked.
I need the specimen to reach it, Mr. Deckard.
To teach them all to fly.
All these years you looked back on that day...
...drunk on the memory of its perfection.
Did it never occur to you that's why you were summoned in the first place?
Designed to do nothing short of fall for her right then and there.
All to make that single perfect specimen.
That is, if you were designed.
It was very clever to keep yourself empty of information...
...and all it cost you was everything.
But you can still help me.
You had help in the hiding.
...and very, very good things can come to you.
You think I have nothing to offer but pain.
Pain reminds you the joy you felt was real.
...I have everything I need to make you talk.
You do not know what pain is yet.
You look like a good joe.
FREYSA: Dying for the right cause is the most human thing we can do.
Because you've never seen a miracle.
LUV: Can we make it? PILOT: We're too low!
You should have let me die out there.
You're free to meet your daughter now.
All the best memories are hers.
